channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NM
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NM

item.title: Report X-2023050533
item.description:
Report X-2023050533

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-18T06:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-08
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: driver discovered damaged package while delivering it. Bc went to pick it up and brought it back to the station. pkg was inside a clear plastic bag. DescribePack: loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was put inside a plastic bag.

item.title: Report E-2023050241
item.description:
Report E-2023050241

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-18T06:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-03
  • City: MENTMORE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 3, 2023, at 1954 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Mentmore, New Mexico regarding the release of approximately 1 gallon of DELTA-THERMâ„¢ AR 8501 Polyol (Chemical under pressure, n.o.s., UN3500, 2.2) from (1) 3500-gallon metal tank. The release was reportedly due to a loading strap striking the release valve. No drains or waterways were affected by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using a pressure washer and the proper PPE. The released material impacted rinse water was containerized in (1) 55-gallon metal drum which was then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023040672
item.description:
Report X-2023040672

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-18T06:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-12
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was damaged and leaking. Manager brought package to QA. Leaking package was inspected and placed inside a plastic bag inside a hazmat drum. DescribePack: Plastic bucket was leaking from the lid possibly a broken seal. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately brought to QA by a manager and inspected as soon as possible . Using gloves package was placed in a hazmat drum.

item.title: Report X-2023040423
item.description:
Report X-2023040423

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-18T06:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-18
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While moving a pallet of freight out of trailer/84852 a shipment of paint behind the pallet being moved fell to the floor of the trailer. A one ~gallon container of paint was damaged in the fall. The spill was cleaned with staydry and the damaged container of paint and the staydry ~were placed int o a recovery drum and are being held for OSandD.

item.title: Report X-2023040341
item.description:
Report X-2023040341

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-18T06:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-11
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: In the process of unloading freight from trailer, Forklift Driver/ANTHONY GRIEGO (936429) punctured a drum at the bottom trying to get under it with blades. Drum was "flipped over to stop the spill." Approximately one quart spilled onto the trailer floor. Spill cleaned. Clean up material and t he damaged drum were placed in a recovery drum and left at OSandD.

The bottom seal was dented and bent there was also a big dent on the side of the drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The drum was immediately brought to QA leaking drum was inspected as soon as possible and placed in a hazmat drum.

item.description:
Report X-2023030815

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-18T06:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-06
  • City: BELEN
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The UTLX 212296 leaked approx. 5 gallons of diesel fuel onto track 7103. The leak was from the sample line. Upon investigation, the plug was missing and the needle valve was open. The HazMat Responder closed the valve and taped and tool-tightened the plug.

item.title: Report X-2023030640
item.description:
Report X-2023030640

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was received in QA due to leakage and place in a hazmat drum. DescribePack: Upon inspection I discovered all the containers were leaking from loose lids. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: After finding where the leaking was coming from, I tightened all the lids.

item.title: Report X-2023030426
item.description:
Report X-2023030426

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-18T06:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-04
  • City: AZTEC
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from the trailer and put to the side. Package was noticeably wet so it was brought to QA and it was confirmed damaged. DescribePack: Lid does not seal properly so if package is on its side or upside down the liquid will come out of the container. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was moved to the repack area and put inside a tote to contain any contents it may leak out.

item.title: Report E-2023050100
item.description:
Report E-2023050100

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-17T21:08:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-27
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 27, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum was damaged and released approximately 5 gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted surface. ER personnel overpacked the damaged drum in one (1) 95-gallon overpack. The crew then utilized industrial cleaner and absorbent pads to clean the area. All amines impacted material was placed in one (1) 30-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023030489
item.description:
Report X-2023030489

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-17T21:08:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-26
  • City: Lucy
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1325MT at MP 827.9 (Willard) on Clovis Sub near Lucy, NM - Z ALTLAC8 25 reporting derailed on MT2. RDWY 138426 involved and on-side. Contents investigation revealed that approximately 45% of the haz paint related material released as a result of being crushed by freight. Remaining material placed in an overpack container for waste disposal. Impacted soils and debris excavated from site and staged for appropriate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023020626
item.description:
Report X-2023020626

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-17T21:08:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-08
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023020626 SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA wet and torn, after further inspection package was safely placed in a hazmat drum. DescribePack: Upon inspection found the container was leaking from the cap, even though cap had a seal under the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: After I noticed the package was leaking from the cap i tightened caps and placed the package in a hazmat drum. 2. X-2023020627 SequenceEvent: The package was brought to QA wet and torn, upon inspection I found the failure was due to leaking caps and placed packages in hazmat drum. DescribePack: The failure was due to leaking caps even though it had a seal under cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: After inspecting package, I tightened the caps and place package in a hazmat drum.

  • Description: Driver stated he wasn't paying attention and a 15-20 gallon overfill occurred. Navajo is aware and driver is cleaning Asphalt up with a shovel. Safety asked driver to ensure he alerts Navajo after Asphalt is cleaned to ensure clean up efforts will suffice

item.title: Report I-2023010016
item.description:
Report I-2023010016

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-17T21:08:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-07
  • City: FARMINGTON
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 12/07/2022 at approximately 0900, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5269340 at the station location in Farmington, reporting an undeclared resin spill. The shipment was a fiberboard box, containing a can labeled resin as well as other nonhazardous items. The package emitted an odor during the loading process. Further research revealed that the resin labeled container leaked inside of the box. The package was not labeled in accordance with IATA Regulations. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2022120758
item.description:
Report X-2022120758

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-17T21:08:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-05
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found damaged Hazmat in WA 339 with a dampened base at around 8 PM. Upon realizing package was both hazardous and damaged, placed package into a spill response bucket and brought to the QA cage for further inspection. DescribePack: Upon further inspection of the damaged hazmat, found 1 of 4 contents to have not had the proper packaging (no tape to seal the cap) which ended up causing leakage throughout packaging. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Placed the damaged package within a spill response bucket and took to the QA cage damage area for further inspection.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver stopped for his 10 Hr break and performed his post trip inspection then went for a walk. he returned to the truck after about 10 minutes and noticed the smell of the product. He investigated and observed a small puddle at the rear near the Internal valve. He placed a bucket under the leak and contacted Safety. Carrier contacted the Environmental Agency to handle cleanup, and to assist with a transload of the product.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler discovered the Hazmat in the tail end, passenger side of the trailer upside down(orientation arrows facing down) side by side other hazmats. Package handler then stopped operations by employing the eBrake on the belt system and notified management immediately. Manager then ensured operations were stopped and proceeded to perform in-house clean up using proper PPE. DescribePack: It was discovered that one of the bottles had a loose cap and product had leaked out. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: Operations were stopped and Hazmat was removed from the belt system by qualified personnel.

  • City: ALBUQUERQUE

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 8, 2022, ten (10) 40 pound-bags of oxidizer were damaged during transit due to a lack of dunnage and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to perform the necessary corrective actions. ER personnel deployed absorbents and worked them in with hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all spent-absorbents into one (1) 30-gallon drum for disposal.

  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: This package was found to be leaking during the sort. It was a white outer bag, a plastic box was one layer down with two inner plastic cannisters. The plastic cannisters were not opened so there may have been inner receptacles inside them. There may have been urine samples in the package. Standard spill cleanup procedures were followed and the package was contained in a 1A2 steel salvage drum pending final disposition. Since the contents were UN 3373, Biological Substance Category B from the package markings, the National Response Center was notified by phone. NRC report # is 1344687.

  • Description: Residue car GATX 64580 was found in the Belen yard with residue on the outside of the car. Mechanical found open liquid and vapor valves with plugs out. Manway was also unsecured with only one swing bolt up and loose, the other swing bolts were all down. No waterways or drains impacted. Car has been secured and cleaned. Origin out of Mexico, difficult to track down address.

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-16
  • City: CLOVIS
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: NM State Hazmat Inspector identified CELX 23213 as leaking while in the Clovis yard. The car was isolated and BNSF Hazmat responder inspected the car finding a small leak coming from the liquid line flange below the valve. 2 of 4 bolts were loose and tightened approximately 1 full turn each to stop the leak. Hazmat Hold placed on the car and shipper notified to request OTMA 1 for movement to destination for offloading and shop for repair/testing. All spilled material evaporated from the car body with no ground impacts.

  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SHPX 207609 was found in Rincon, NM to be actively leaking front the top of the car. Upon inspection, it was noted that the liquid line was leaking from the cap. The cap was found to be tool tight, but no thread sealant was found on the threads. Responder vented car by opening vent, removed the cap, applied thread sealant and secured the cap, tool tight. Car was cleaned as well as soil remediated and released.

  • City: ALBUQUERQUE

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was dropped causing the glass container to shatter. All contents were put in a plastic tub to contain the spill and absorbent towels were used to clean up around the affected area. DescribePack: The only damage to the box was it getting wet from the liquid. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was moved away from area of work and was kept shut to minimize the amount of fumes released.

item.title: Report E-2022060085
item.description:
Report E-2022060085

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-17T21:08:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-02
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GREENWOOD MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Trailer OA5738 and pro 429677397, arrived damaged due to no dunnage used causing (2), (55-gallon) drums of gray paint primer to fall in transit. This resulted in other freight puncturing the drums causing the release of (7.5) gallons into trailer. The spill was cleaned and material placed into an overpack for proper disposal.
